meanings.definition: Bring (goods or services) into a country from abroad for sale.
meanings.sent1: She was importing exotic spices to sell at her store.
meanings.sent2: The company is importing new technology to improve their products.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked about importing magic beans to make the food taste better.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like importing sunshine into a rainy day.
meanings.sent5: The act of importing goods brought a sense of excitement to the market.

meanings.definition: Bring (data) into a file or document from another program.
meanings.sent1: He was importing photos from his camera to his computer.
meanings.sent2: The student is importing research findings into her report.
meanings.sent3: The computer seemed confused when importing too much information at once.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like importing fresh ideas into a stale conversation.
meanings.sent5: Importing data into the system made the process faster and more efficient.

meanings.definition: To bring in from a foreign country for use or sale.
meanings.sent1: They were importing luxury cars from Europe to sell in their showroom.
meanings.sent2: The store is importing handmade crafts from Asia to diversify their products.
meanings.sent3: Importing unique items from abroad added a touch of elegance to the shop.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like importing joy from distant lands.
meanings.sent5: The act of importing goods from overseas created a sense of cultural exchange.
